<JD_START>
Job Title: Process/Mechanical Engineering Team Lead - Memphis, TN

Location: Memphis, TN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Consulting, Engineering, Manufacturing

Description:
A Great Opportunity for Growth Within a Successful Company!
Join one of the United States' most progressive and innovative construction, automation and engineering firms. EAD supports clients' projects on hundreds of systems in industrial manufacturing facilities specializing in food, pharmaceutical and parcel. This opportunity will enable you to enjoy a fast-paced environment working on projects of all sizes and complexities!
EAD is looking for a Process/Mechanical Engineering Team Lead to oversee drafters, designers and/engineers while playing a lead role in the scope, definition, and design of projects per client's requirements. Manages the day-to-day operation of a team, including the scheduling of routine functions and coordination for team project implementations and resources.
ResponsibilitiesPerforms leadership functions on a team, including mentoring of team members and dissemination of pertinent information to the teamCoordinates the day-to-day operation of the team, including the scheduling of work, prioritizing of work assignments, implementation of projects, and assigning of projectsPerforms in a leadership/supervisory role, including coaching opportunities of team members, completion of performance evaluations with leadership members, participation in the hiring process, and mentoring of team membersActs as a liaison between the team and the leadership team, keeping management informed of task accomplishments, issues and status of team activities against the program or scheduleServe as a focal point to communicate and resolve interface and integration issues with other teams to improve department operationsUses data indicators to schedule workload, schedule maintenance, improve operations, and identify system problems/trends while escalating issues which cannot be resolved by the teamWorks in close cooperation with other team/project leaders to develop cost, schedule and performance requirements for projectsPlays a leading role in process and mechanical engineering scope definition and designInterface with clients, vendors, construction administrators, and project teamsPerform and document technical design reviews with other disciplines on the project team to produce the highest level of qualityCapable of being the lead on projects over $5MCapable and experienced in managing and performing projects in a fast-paced environmentTime management and prioritization of tasks to achieve results within cost and schedule constraintsPerform other related duties as assigned
Requirements:B.S. Degree in Mechanical or Chemical Engineering from an accredited institution4 years mechanical design, engineering process plants, and overall facility design experienceDemonstrate strong interpersonal and communication skills to provide effective leadership for scheduling and technical operations coordinationDemonstrate a high degree of self-motivation and performs in a highly independent manner with minimal supervisionSkilled at performing and providing leadership during routine and stressful situationsSkilled at managing technical projectsDemonstrate strong analytical and organizational abilities in order to make effective decisions in an expedient manner, while maintaining high quality of standardsAbility to teach and mentor team members consisting of drafters, designers and engineersAbility to prioritize resources based upon needs and established protocolsExperience in specifying process and/or mechanical equipment for industrial and commercial projectsExperience in heat transfer, material handling, process safety, HVAC, piping and/or plumbing systems strongly preferredKnowledge of building codes and NFPA standardsWorking knowledge of AutoCADExperience with MS Windows based operating systems and applicationsStrong attention to detailPossess and able to maintain a valid driver's licenseAbility to multi-task while working on numerous projects simultaneouslyProficient in Microsoft Office
Working Conditions:Office environmentAbility to sit and work at computer for extended periods of timeAbility to walk up numerous flights of stairs and/or work in confined spaces in extreme conditionsAbility to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.Periodic weekend or evening work as neededTravel may be required
*EAD will provide training, administrative/engineering controls, and personal protective equipment, as necessary.
We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better workplace for our employees and a better product for our customers.
EAD is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
